raw.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: raw substances are in a natural state and not treated or prepared for use
raw.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: In its raw state, cocoa is very bitter.
Raw sewage had been dumped in the river.
The cost of our raw materials has risen significantly.
raw.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: raw information is collected but not organized, examined, or developed
raw.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: software to convert raw data into usable information
His time here provided the raw material for his novel.
Warhol used everyday items as the raw ingredients of his art.
raw.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: raw feelings are strong and natural, but not fully controlled
raw.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Linda didnâ€™t want to see Roy while her emotions were still raw.
It took raw courage to admit she was wrong.
raw.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: if a part of your body is raw, the skin there is red and painful
raw.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: The skin on my feet was rubbed raw.
raw.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: not experienced or not fully trained
raw.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: Most of our soldiers are raw recruits.
raw.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: She shivered in the raw morning air.
raw.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: music, art, language etc that is raw is simple, direct, and powerful, but not fully developed
raw.translation[0].definitions[7].exampl: Her voice has a raw poetic beauty.
His early sketches are raw and unpretentious.
raw.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: raw metals or other substances are in their natural state and have not been prepared or used to make anything
raw.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: German companies produced 6.1% less raw iron in March.
raw.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: information that has not been arranged, checked, or prepared in any way
raw.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: The system collects raw data about which products a customer has purchased.
